name: indignantly
content:

in an angry way, because of something that is wrong or not fair: "I said no such thing!" she cried indignantly. He indignantly denied that he ever treated the two children differently. See
indignant
More examplesFewer examplesThe TV news anchors indignantly claimed to have footage of the incident.The editor indignantly denied the authors' assertion that he suppressed publication of embarrassing financial documents.He stumbled and looked indignantly at the ground as if something had intentionally tripped him.
